topics.body:
"@Meresflut":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53c8b2866368722c503c0400#post_53c8b2866368722c503c0400
Actually you'd be surprised at how intelligent a child can be when given the opportunity. A child can often develop his or own own sense of morality. They're almost erratic way of thinking can lead to some interesting solutions to problems. They are also more accepting than a lot of adults. Prejudices are not born into a person they're taught.
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53c8b3726368722e827c0400#post_53c8b3726368722e827c0400
nah. Many prejudices are inborn. babies naturally mistrust people who look very different from their parents. This includes other races.
Not all prejudices are inborn naturally
topics.author: 4fe16df67f123b13e400003f

topics.body:
"@Meresflut":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53c8b1556368722f61730300#post_53c8b1556368722f61730300
Not constantly, just at times.
topics.author: 513e68eda4c72d4e3b000164

topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53c8b3ae6368722f1f920400#post_53c8b3ae6368722f1f920400
But that's only a survival mechanism that leaves after a certain age.
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53c8b3726368722e827c0400#post_53c8b3726368722e827c0400
I guess you have the voice of experience here, kind of silly of me arguing about pedagogy with someone who actually knows about it.
The world is a curious place dont you think?
topics.author: 520901737f123b14a50000d8

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53c8b3ef6368722da4e60400#post_53c8b3ef6368722da4e60400
But it is inborn. And it never leaves really.

topics.body: So, I have a problem, I need someone to tell how to get rid of a rat, yes a fat, furry, disease carrying rodent.
topics.author: 520901737f123b14a50000d8

topics.body:
"@Meresflut":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53c8b7026368722c50e20600#post_53c8b7026368722c50e20600
Swallow it whole.
topics.author: 5007bbdf7f123b112f00023a

topics.body:
here, here it is.

"here it is the first brony ever":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lIPUnIWi7Yc 


"@Meresflut":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53c8b7026368722c50e20600#post_53c8b7026368722c50e20600

put traps, simple as that, poison food and put it near the place the rat goes regularly.
